title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Trump eyes fresh tariff probe focused on foreign drug prices
Army undergoing a high-tech upgrade for next-gen battles
items.summary:
- The Indian Army is modernizing 382 infantry battalions to counter tech-driven warfare, inducting **sniper rifles**, **rocket-launchers**, **loitering munitions**, night sights and other advanced gear.
- It is deploying nine drone types for ISR and suicide missions, raising *Ashni* drone platoons and **Bhairav** commando units to boost battlefield transparency and rapid strike.
- Key deals include ₹2,770 crore for 4.2 lakh carbines (60% Bharat Forge, rest PLR), plus **Javelin launchers** and missiles to bolster **ATGMs**, with rifles upgraded to **7.62 mm**.

items.title: India calls for closer South-South ties in critical minerals, fertilisers
Govt tightens oversight of edible oil with VOPPA order
items.summary:
- The government now requires all edible oil stakeholders to register under the *VOPPA Order, 2025* and submit monthly production and stock returns online.
- The amendment seeks greater regulatory oversight and real-time data to bolster India’s *food security* and *supply-chain resilience*.
- Non-compliance will be treated as a violation, with penalties and planned inspections to enforce registration and reporting.

items.title: Volkswagen warns workers of potential stoppages as chip crunch looms
VW prepares staff for temporary plant closures, Bild
items.summary:
- *VW* is preparing staff for potential temporary plant closures, per *Bild*, citing an internal management letter warning of disruptions. 
- The memo says current production hasn't yet been hit by *chip shortages* but warns disruptions could arise as the situation evolves. 
- VW said it would pause production of two key models but denied any link to the *Nexperia* supply-chain dispute.

items.title: TKSE due diligence deepens as Jindal bids
items.summary:
- *TKSE* due diligence to deepen next week as *Jindal Steel* gains greater access to financial details.
- *Jindal Steel* has made an indicative bid; pension liabilities (~€2.7B) pose a major hurdle.
- The plan includes over €2B for capacity expansion, including a direct reduction plant in *Duisburg* and more *electric arc furnaces*, aiming for carbon-neutral steel.

items.title: China probes US chipmakers for sensitive data
items.summary:
- *China's Trade Remedy and Investigation Bureau* has opened an anti-dumping probe into certain American *analog IC chips*, requesting sensitive sales data from U.S. chipmakers such as *Texas Instruments* and *Analog Devices*. 
- The questionnaires seek sales in China, names of Chinese customers, transaction details, and cost‑to‑profit comparisons, with a 37‑day window to respond. 
- The move follows US export controls and broader tech tensions, signaling reciprocal pressure even as Beijing emphasizes security concerns.

items.title: Coal Ministry widens indigenous tech in gasification
items.author: ETGovernment Desk
items.summary:
- The Coal Ministry widened the definition of *indigenous technology* under its gasification financial-support scheme to include foreign-developed tech adapted in India with **significant innovation** and viability.
- It clarified that tech developed, owned, and substantially proven in India— including patents or IP— will be considered *indigenous*, and that technologies adapted via collaboration or technology transfer can qualify if they show **significant development** and independent commercialisation in Indian conditions.
- The changes allow category flexibility, CCUS integration in pilot/small-scale projects, and exempt underground coal gasification (UCG) from the proven indigenous technology requirement with a ₹100 crore minimum cap, while maintaining the 30% net-worth rule to accelerate investment in coal and lignite gasification.

items.title: Govt to hold Open House on steel import issues
items.author: IANS
items.summary:
- The Ministry of Steel will hold an *Open House* on October 27 at Udyog Bhavan to discuss issues related to the *import of steel* in Delhi.
- The event runs 12:00 noon to 6:00 pm; only one representative per organisation and pre-registration by email are required, with time-slots confirmed by October 24.
- This follows pressure from cheaper imports—especially from *China*—and a 12% safeguard duty in April 2025 to shield *domestic producers* under the *Make in India* initiative.

items.title: Tobacco Board sets Nov 30 deadline for 2026 renewal
items.summary:
- The Tobacco Board has directed manufacturers, exporters, processors, dealers and packers to register or renew for 2026, with *November 1* for fresh registrations and *November 30* for renewals, all submitted online via the Board's portal.
- E-filing is mandatory and applicants must upload self-certified copies of documents along with statutory returns under the *Tobacco Board Rules, 1976*.
- Violations such as licensing or trading without a valid licence will invite action under the *Tobacco Board Act, 1975*, with all applications required to be filed on the official online system.

items.title: India shifts renewables from speed to system strength
items.summary: - *Dispatchable* grid, storage, and market reforms underpin India's shift from rapid capacity additions to a stronger, integrated system. - India aims for **500 GW** of non-fossil capacity by 2030, anchored by grid integration and transmission expansion. - Despite a recalibration, annual additions remain high (15–25 GW), with ~40 GW nearing PPAs and a ₹2.4 lakh crore Transmission Plan unlocking over 200 GW.

items.title: NMDC cuts iron ore lump and fines rates
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- NMDC cuts iron ore lump by *₹550/tonne* and fines by *₹500/tonne*, setting lump at ₹5,550 and fines at ₹4,750 per tonne, effective immediately.
- The revision follows no change for two months, signaling pressure in the domestic *steel market*.
- Iron ore prices influence steel costs across *construction*, *infrastructure*, *automobile*, and *railways*.

items.title: Heineken India's volume slips on unusual rains
items.summary:
- Heineken India's beer volume declined by *mid-single-digit* in the Sep quarter due to unusually heavy *monsoon rains*. 
- Organic net revenue grew by a *mid-single-digit*, helped by *price hikes* in key states and portfolio mix. 
- Premium beer volume grew in the *low teens*, led by Ultra Max and Amstel Grande, despite overall volume headwinds.

items.title: Superhealth signs ₹2,500-cr radiology pact
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- *Superhealth* inked a multi-year deal worth over ₹2,500 crore with *United Imaging Healthcare* for advanced radiology systems across 100 upcoming hospitals. 
- Under the pact, United Imaging will supply, install, and lifecycle-manage a suite including *AI-ready MRI*, 160-slice CT, full-body *cardiac CT*, digital mammography and X-ray, plus a dedicated India service hub and parts depot, creating over 1,000 high-skill jobs. 
- The 100-hospital pipeline aims to generate about 50,000 healthcare jobs by 2030, boosting access to world-class imaging in India.

items.title: DGCA approves AVPL International’s Hisar drone training centre
items.summary:
- DGCA approved the Drone Remote Pilot Training Organisation (RPTO) of **AVPL International** in *Hisar*. 
- The RPTO includes **10 DGCA‑approved flying zones** to provide practical training in *drone operation* and maintenance. 
- Founder and MD *Preet Sandhu* says the initiative will equip India’s youth with *drone skills* and create employment, especially in rural areas.

items.title: RIICO's first plug-and-play factory in Rajasthan
items.author: ETGovernment Desk
items.summary: - The project is RIICO's first plug-and-play **Flatted Factory Complex** in Sitapura, offering ready-to-move modules on a license-fee basis via online allocation for micro enterprises. - The ₹25 crore project includes 33 modules across four floors with 1,236–1,566 sq ft spaces, leased at ₹18 per sq ft for 1–7 years via e-bidding, with ₹10.23 crore grant under MSE-CDP. - In the first phase, 30 modules go to garment & apparel micro-entrepreneurs, with six modules reserved for women, SC/ST, ex-servicemen, and differently-abled applicants; EMD window 24 Oct–3 Nov 2025 and e-bidding on 4 Nov 2025.

items.title: Cheap imports, dumping hurt India's steel sector (RBI)
items.summary:
- The RBI *October Bulletin* links cheap *imports* and *dumping* to lower domestic steel production, calling for **policy support** to boost competitiveness.
- It notes a 22% rise in imports in 2023‑24, driven by softer prices, widening the gap between domestic demand and output.
- It recommends **safeguard duties**, plus innovation and cost efficiency, to shield India’s steel sector from dumping.

items.title: Himadri Chemicals Q2 PAT soars 39% YoY
items.summary:
- *Q2FY26 PAT* rose 39% YoY to ₹187 crores, with revenue ₹1,070 crores and *EBITDA* ₹243 crores.
- *Anurag Choudhary*, CMD & CEO, credited focus on *high value-added products*, *operational efficiency*, and *yield improvement*.
- *Half-year PAT* ₹369 crores (+43% YoY) and *EBITDA* ₹477 crores; Q2 revenue dipped due to lower *raw material prices*.

items.title: Fertiliser imports jump on good rains, rabi hopes
items.author: Shambhavi Anand, ET Bureau
items.summary: - September fertiliser imports surged with *urea* at 1.94 million tonnes and *DAP* at 881,000 tonnes, up from 312,000 and 379,000 a year earlier. - The rise followed an excellent *monsoon* that boosted soil moisture and lifted hopes for a strong *rabi* crop. - Imports of complex fertilisers (NPKs) jumped 685% to 479,000 tonnes, signaling robust demand ahead of winter sowing.

items.title: Steel Ministry to hold talks on imports
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- The *Open House* by the Ministry of Steel on October 27, 2025, 12:00 noon to 6:00 pm at the Steel Room, Udyog Bhawan, New Delhi, will address **steel imports** issues.
- The session aims to facilitate direct interaction with *industry stakeholders* on import-related concerns, with time slots communicated by email prior to the event.
- To participate, organizations must email *tech-steel@nic.in* by 11:00 am on October 24, 2025, to secure a time slot; only **one representative per organization** is allowed, and walk-ins are not permitted.

items.title: 'Weighty' FMCG matters: Prices repacked, value unpacked as FMCG repurposes pack sizes
Building the backbone of India’s EV revolution: Why manufacturing matters more than ever
Amazon plans to replace more than half a million jobs with robots
items.summary: - *Amazon* plans to replace more than half a million *jobs* with *robots*, per internal documents cited by *The New York Times*.\n- The automation could save around $0.30 per item and help avoid hiring over 160,000 U.S. workers by 2027.\n- Amazon aims to automate up to 75% of operations and is evaluating measures to mitigate fallout, including corporate citizenship efforts.

items.title: MIC Electronics wins RDSO approval for rail controller
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- MIC Electronics has secured RDSO certification for its *indigenously developed* microprocessor controller used in roof-mounted AC units for LHB and double-decker coaches.
- The controller was designed and built in India and complies with all *RDSO* specifications, enabling *energy efficiency*, *smart controls*, and *IoT-enabled operations*.
- With the approval, MIC Electronics can directly supply the controller to *Indian Railways*, boosting efficiency and safety in railway coach AC systems.

items.title: OPmobility sales hit by FX, plant shutdowns
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- *OPmobility* reported a 1% YoY revenue drop to 2.72 billion euros for Q3 due to currency headwinds and European client plant shutdowns. 
- A 95 million euro currency impact and a Jaguar Land Rover production halt weighed on Europe, with North America and Asia providing partial offset. 
- The company aims for strong year-end performance and has signed a LOI with **Chery** and contracts to supply bumpers in Spain and Brazil.

items.title: Airbus opens second China assembly line, targets growth
items.summary:
- Airbus opened a second final assembly line in *Tianjin, China* to boost the *A320neo* family output toward **75 aircraft per month by 2027** as part of a broader expansion.
- The move follows a corresponding expansion in *Mobile, Alabama* and is part of a plan for **10 global final assembly lines** to lift production.
- Analysts note competition from **Boeing** and **COMAC** amid trade tensions shaping the global aerospace market.

items.title: EU, China to hold 'urgent' talks on rare earth curbs
items.summary: - *EU* trade chief **Maros Sefcovic** and China's **Wang Wentao** held a nearly two-hour video call and agreed to intensify contacts, with an invitation for China to come to Brussels for urgent solutions. - The EU says China's export restrictions have forced some bloc companies to halt production and caused economic harm; Sefcovic called the measures unjustified and harmful. - Beijing has announced new controls on rare-earth exports while Brussels coordinates with the **G7** and seeks a prompt, non-escalatory resolution.

items.title: SSAB beats estimates, calls end to cheap Asian steel
items.summary: - SSAB's Q3 operating earnings rose **50%** to *1.87 billion SEK*, beating estimates of *1.75 billion SEK*.\n- The company says the European market is pressured by energy costs and **cheap imports from Asia**, urging policymakers to curb the flow.\n- Q4 outlook is **uncertain** as demand softens and maintenance looms in North America and Europe, while tariffs partly cushion the US hit.

items.title: AGI Greenpac posts H1 profit rise, capacity expansion
items.summary:
- AGI Greenpac reported H1 FY26 revenue of *₹1,289 crore*, up *11%*, with net profit *₹165 crore* and EBITDA *₹330 crore*.
- In Q2 FY26, revenue *₹602 crore*, EBITDA *₹154 crore*, and net profit *₹76 crore*.
- Expansion plan includes a greenfield glass plant in Madhya Pradesh adding *500 TPD* (≈30% capacity); a two-phase aluminium cans facility in Uttar Pradesh (initial *950 million cans*, rising to *1.6 billion* by FY30); and upgrades at Container Glass to *1,900 TPD* and Specialty Glass to *200 TPD* by March 2026.

items.title: Indian Army signs MoU with Delhi Technological University to boost defence technology and AI skills
Export tariffs to US to drop to 15-16% under deal
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- The Mint report says tariffs on Indian exports to the US could fall to **15–16%** from the current ~50% once a bilateral trade agreement is finalised, likely at the ASEAN summit. 
- The deal may require India to cut imports of Russian crude oil and include energy-trade concessions from the US; penal tariffs could be withdrawn after Nov 30, with reciprocal duties down to **10–15%**. 
- The US remains India's largest export destination with about **$86.5 billion** in FY25 shipments, so tariff relief could boost sectors like *textiles*, *engineering goods*, and *chemicals*.

items.title: YEIDA set to sign pact with Japan agency for medical device park
items.author: Aditya Dev, TIMESOFINDIA.COM
items.summary:
- YEIDA will sign a MoU with *Medical Excellence Japan* to attract *Japanese investment* and technology to its Sector 28 medical devices park, boosting manufacturing, R&D, and exports. 
- The MoU will enable *technology transfer* and open export channels to the Japanese market, with a MEJ delegation visiting YEIDA to finalise details and explore joint ventures. 
- Plans include a Rs 125-crore factory complex (38,665 sqm) with 240 plug‑and‑play units and IIT Kanpur collaboration to strengthen *Make in India* and position YEIDA as a global medical device hub.

items.title: India plans ₹10,000-crore missile purchase from Russia to boost S-400 capabilities
India-made cars excel in exports amid domestic challenges
items.summary: - Exports rose nearly *20%* in the first half of FY26, led by Maruti Suzuki, Hyundai, Nissan and VW.\n- Maruti Suzuki targets over *4 lakh* units in FY2025-26, while overseas shipments like Fronx, Jimny, Swift, Baleno and Dzire have already crossed two lakh in H1.\n- Industry leaders say India is becoming a key export hub, with Hyundai aiming for up to *30%* export share to 150+ countries and Nissan calling India its second-largest AMIEO export hub, including EVs like the *eVitara*.

items.title: Mumbai becomes home to India’s largest 3D printing setup
Namibia cuts 2025 growth forecast due to manufacturing slump
items.summary:
- Namibia cut its 2025 growth forecast to *3.3%* from **4.5%** amid a *manufacturing slump* tied to lower diamond processing and reduced cement and blister copper output.
- The outlook for the primary sector remains positive at about *2.5%* this year, with a three-year average near *3.6%*, down from earlier estimates.
- A wider budget deficit at *4.0% of GDP* and a central-bank rate cut to *6.50%* are aimed at reviving activity.

items.title: China files complaint, says India's PLI schemes for auto, EV policy violate WTO norms
Chipmaker CXMT plans Shanghai listing with $42 billion valuation, sources say
Charter cuts ~1,200 jobs to streamline corporate roles
items.summary:
- **Charter Communications** cuts about **1,200** corporate-management roles to streamline operations.
- *The layoffs are limited to corporate roles* and are not expected to affect sales or service teams as the company centralizes functions.
- The move follows peers and aligns with Charter's plan to expand via the **$21.9B Cox acquisition** to become a leading cable and broadband provider.

items.title: India's smartphone shipments rise 3% in Q3, Apple sees record growth: Report
Telecom PLI fails to increase local addition in 4G, 5G networking gear
CCI clears Torrent Pharma's proposal to buy stake in JB Chemicals
Coca-Cola tops estimates on zero-sugar, small packs
items.summary:
- Coca-Cola beat quarterly estimates as demand for *zero-sugar drinks* and smaller packs boosts sales.
- The company maintained its *full-year targets* despite a cautious global environment, executives said.
- Volume growth in *Europe, the Middle East and Africa* helped offset softness in other regions.

items.title: Rajasthan's first e-bus plant in Ghiloth
items.summary:
- Rajasthan govt allot **65 acres** in **Ghiloth Industrial Area** (Kotputli-Behror) to **PMI Electro Mobility Solutions** for a **₹1,200 crore** e-bus plant, the state's first such facility.
- The plant will manufacture *e-buses*, *bus bodies*, *motors*, *batteries*, *wire harnesses*, and other spare parts with an initial investment of **₹1,200 crore**, creating direct and indirect jobs.
- Chief Minister Bhajanlal Sharma said the project will push industrial development and align with **Make in India**, while promoting *green energy* and *sustainable urban transport*.

items.title: Taiwan’s exports hit record high on surging global AI chip demand
items.summary:
- Taiwan's September exports rose 30.5% year-on-year to a record US$70.2 billion, driven by demand for *AI technology*. 
- Taiwan remains a global powerhouse in *semiconductor chips*, with shipments to the US, Southeast Asia, and China rising and reinforcing its role in *global chip production*. 
- The surge comes amid an *AI arms race*, underscoring the long-term importance of Taiwan's tech sector and firms like *TSMC* in shaping the AI infrastructure.

items.title: Danaher beats estimates on diagnostic tools demand
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- *Danaher* beat Wall Street's Q3 profit and revenue estimates on strong demand for its diagnostic tools and services. 
- It maintained full-year adjusted earnings guidance, delivering **$1.89** per share on **$6.05 billion** revenue, versus estimates of **$1.72** and **$6.01 billion**. 
- China softness persisted amid policy changes, but demand in clinical diagnostics and applied markets stayed stable; Danaher planned supply-chain and cost-saving steps to offset tariffs.

items.title: GM boosts full-year outlook as it foresees a smaller impact from tariffs and 3Q results top Street
GST reforms may trigger surge in paper imports
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- *IPMA* warns GST reforms could turn India into a dumping ground for cheaper imported paper, risking domestic producers and the *Make in India* mission.
- With GST changes, uncoated paper for notebooks is *GST-exempt*, making IGST on imports nil and denying Indian manufacturers ITC, widening the price gap with imports.
- Imports have surged from 1.08 million tonnes (FY21) to 2.06 million tonnes (FY25), nearly ₹15,000 crore in value, about a 17% CAGR.

items.title: India's smartphone shipments rise 3% in September quarter: Apple sees record growth: Report
